inclusion.criterion: 16-year-old girl recently diagnosed with myasthenia gravis, class IIa.
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: positive anti-AChR antibody test and single fiber electromyography (SFEMG) was positive.

inclusion.criterion: complains of diplopia and weakness affecting in her upper extremities.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: on acetylcholinesterase inhibitor treatment combined with immunosuppressants.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: history of bronchial asthma, emphysema, heart block, angina, cardiomyopathy or myocardial infarction.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: any history or signs of congestive cardiac failure, or arrhythmia with a ventricular rate of less than 60 bpm.
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has myasthenia gravis and is on treatment. However, she still experiences symptoms.
